description: This book is a commentary book of 44 volumes written by Motoori Norinaga. This book, published in the Edo period, interprets the Kojiki as a fact, and writes the history of ancient Japan with thought.
It is a book dealing with Japanese animism faith. In Shinto, it is believed that God dwells in all things, and it treats not only Tenjin, the earth but also nature and even spirits as gods.
